title: Free-body diagram - which figure accelerates up

content.prompt: If the acceleration is directed up the ramp, which figure best represents the free-body diagram for the box and what evidence supports the claim?

choices.label: Figure 1: There is nothing opposing the force of friction that is directed up the ramp.
Figure 1: For friction to be directed up the ramp, the box must be sliding down the ramp, and therefore its speed is decreasing.
Figure 2: Any amount of force pushing the object up the ramp would cause it to accelerate in that direction.
Figure 2: The pushing force is greater in magnitude than friction and the component of gravity parallel to the ramp.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
